hypothesis: Rule: Combinations are valid when the shapes of two objects are the same and their textures differ.
Rule: Combinations can only be made if the shapes are the same and the textures are different.
Rule: Combinations can only occur between objects of the same shape but require different textures (e.g., plain with dotted) for valid pairs.
Rule: Combinations are valid when the shapes are the same and the textures are either the same or different.
Rule: Objects can only be combined if they share the same shape and texture type.
Rule: Combinations can only occur between objects of the same shape and where at least one object has a different texture.
Rule: Objects can only combine if they share the same shape and their textures are either both plain or both patterned (striped, dotted, or checkered).
Rule: Combinations are only valid if the shapes are the same and the textures are different.
Rule: Color and pattern combination of compatible shapes often results in a new shape of a different color and pattern, while incompatible combinations or those with similar types result in failure.
